headline: Brazilian White Rice
description: White rice is the main side dish made in Brazil. This is the way my mom would make it and taught my sister and I. What makes this so different is that we fry it in oil with minced onion and garlic before adding water. You can also use part water, part chicken broth. The secret is to not let it overcook because it should come out loose and not sticky.
name: Brazilian White Rice

recipeInstructions.text: Place the rice in a colander and rinse thoroughly with cold water; set aside.

Heat the oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook the onion in the oil for one minute. Stir in the garlic and cook until the garlic is golden brown. Add the rice and salt and cook and stir until the rice begins to brown. Pour hot water over rice mixture and stir. Reduce heat to low, cover the saucepan, and allow to simmer until the water has been absorbed, 20 to 25 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I was searching for a recipe that was similar to a PR restaurant in my neighborhood. This was amazing copy. It needs to be paired with other food and is intentionally plain to complement your main dish. I didn’t have cal rose, so I used what I had - Japanese rice. Salt and oil really brings out a buttery flavor of the rice. The two of us kept going back for more and finished off the whole batch. Made this with pollo Al horno as the main.
It was pretty tasty but definitely needed some more garlic but a good starting point!
Wen I made this I thought it was a little to bland, next time I’ll add chicken broth to give it more flavor
Soooooo easy to make and so good! It’s my first time rice actually turned out good! Thanks for the easy easy recipe! Who knew adding a bit of onion and garlic would make this recipe so good!

THE BEST rice ever and sooo easy! I can't cook rice any other way now.

This was delicious with just the right amount garlic and onion. I appreciated the mellow flavor of this rice to go along with several Brazilian dishes, including a Feijoada, that are already packed with lots of flavor. Out of habit, the method I used to cook the rice was a little different and used a little less water (sautéed onion and garlic, sautéed rice for a few minutes, add in water, salt, and cover with tight fitted lid for the same time as directed in recipe). I will definitely make this recipe again!
Delicious! perfect for plain white rice.
Simple to prepare, with excellent results.

The family loved it! I used less rice and found that browning the rice in a saucepan was a bit difficult. The rice itself doesn’t brown but it takes a brownish hue from the onions and garlic. It is way more tasty than plain white rice and doesn’t take that much more time.

This recipe is okay if all you've ever eaten was plain white rice. I agree w/ some others...it was just a bit on the bland side. I even used chicken broth to cook it in.

It was a different take on rice. Fairly good but expected a little more. I think I should have let the onions and garlic cook a little longer before stirring in the rice.
Reminded me of making rice-a-roni, but was very bland.
Great flavor

Hi, I'm the submitter of this recipe. I just wanted to say thank you to all who have tried it and hope that you enjoy it with your loved ones. Although I love this recipe as it was passed on to me, it is very versatile. I play with it all the time! Feel free to do it too. My mom always used vegetable oil but due to personal taste I use olive oil and In addition, I frequently use chicken or vegetable broth, and add more onion and garlic. However if you prefer it to be more subtle then follow the recipe. You can use this method with most types of rice. It works well with brown basmati rice and I have tried it with vegetable medley and brown medley rice too. But beware that It will take longer to cook and may require more tweaking with the water or broth. I always get so many comments about how nice it smells while cooking. Please note that there is one other thing I do frequently... I partially uncover it during the last 5 minutes of cooking. This helps to speed up the cooking and ensures that it doesn't get sticky.

Great turn on plain old rice. I didn't have onion but had a giant clove of garlic. Use sesame oil as a twist to add even more nuttiness to toasting the rice first. I did put some soy on mine after it was done. Very yummy day before payday meal. I may add fresh peas next time too. Versatile.
Just like my Brazilian mom made for us at home
Even my son who is not a rice fan gave it a 2 thumbs up. Very simple, but very tasty.

This is the best basic recipe for white rice, with a tiny ehancement. Texture is fluffy, moist but not sticky every single time. Instead of salt and plain boiled water, I leave out the salt and dissolve two chicken bouillon cubes in the four cups of boiling water required. That pumps up the flavor a lot!

It took me a while to decide on what to rate this dish. Made exactly as written, and we found it a bit bland. But it is what it says it is... White rice. This is a basic white rice dish in terms to flavours. What's special about this dish is the cooking method. It was so fragrant cooking the rice in the oil, onion and garlic mixture. My rice came out perfectly cooked in 20 minutes covered on a low simmer. And for that reason it was good. It was a good basic white rice.. Which cooked up better then good. I probably won't use this rice dish as a side again but it would be great served under a flavourful stirfry or curry. What I will take from this recipe though is the method of cooking.. I'm looking forward to using that again. 
Thanks!
Love love love this rice! It's easy to make and if you like fresh garlic flavor try it out it's awesome!

Good basic recipe but found it too bland when I followed it exactly. I'm going to try adding some canned pineapple chunks to the leftovers tomorrow for a different twist. If I made it again I'd double the minced onion, adding maybe 1/8 tsp ground black pepper, and also 1 tbsp either dry or finely chopped fresh parsley.

I t was simple and had a great taste. I did add a little chicken seasoning powder to add a little more taste due to some ratings and I don't regret it at all, i suggest other to do it if you don't like your rice bland.

Browned white rice in EEVO on medium heat. Doubled onion and garlic measurements and added 2 small cans of sliced mushrooms. Also added 5 chicken bouillon cubes instead of the salt. Cooked as directed. Family is eating now while I take a break from standing over the stove. It is very quiet over there-all I hear is forks tapping plates. A definite thumbs up for this recipe! Dinner is Brazilian White Rice, garden salad (Romaine lettuce, with thinly sliced veggies; cucumbers, onion, carrots, green pepper, radishes, and celery) and baked chicken (legs, thighs, wings) with garlic salt and pepper until crispy-385 degrees, 45 minutes each side ending with skin side up. I have just finished eating dinner. What is great about this side dish recipe is that the flavor is delicate and compliments any dish without competing with it. Perfect dinner!
